attributes.action: Reduce or 'bring into line' software prices so that software sold in the US should be of a similar price to software sold in the UK.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Computer software prices are generally higher in the UK, than the same product in the US. An example of this would be Microsofts new Operating System Vista. In the UK you will pay around £220 for the Home premium version of Vista, but in America you could pick up the same software for $230.00 (£115). The same applies to many software houses; and download sites. The country is per capita more wealthy, yet we have to pay sometimes in excess of 100% more for the same product.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Reduce or 'bring into line' software prices so that software sold in the US should be of a similar price to software sold in the UK."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page15122.asp
